job description:
WHO WE ARE:

Roche Sequencing Solutions (Santa Clara) is a nanopore based sequencing group of Roche dedicated to making clinical genetic testing easy and affordable. We are developing a revolutionary, low cost single-molecule DNA sequencer that can potentially improve the lives of people in a wide variety of ways including timely screening for diseases and diagnosis of various cancers.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

Manages consumable device EOL test team:
  • Responsible for establishing plans for areas of responsibility with input from senior management.
  • Focusing on deliverables of own distinct areas and ensuring its objectives are aligned with company-wide objectives.
  • Conceiving and conducting advanced independent research/development experiments from project inception through product launch and field support.
  • Recommending new or creative approaches, and expansion or curtailment of investigation based on scientific information.
  • Assuming responsibility for timely completion of projects, consistent with project critical path, and responding appropriately to changing priories.
  • Ensuring technical activities under delegated supervision are conducted within internal and external guidelines and regulations.
  • Interacting with other departments and function teams to further the project goals
  • Guide the development staff through the various phases of product development with highly productive interactions, with core R&D teams, engineering, document control and manufacturing  
  • Accountable for the NGS consumable device development and validation plans and execution, system design, readiness and transition from Development to Commercial and Lab Operations.
Manages, records, and presents data:
  • Accurately and consistently recording experimental method, materials, and results.
  • Analyzing data, forming conclusions, and determining future experiments.
  • Presenting findings or comprehensive project status reviews at internal meetings.
  • Applying advanced technical writing skills to produce reports and documents such as summaries, SOPs, DHFs, presentations and manuscripts.
Additional Responsibilities for Principal Scientist I:
  • Frequent contact with external resources and contacts at various management levels concerning operations or scheduling of specific phases of projects.
  • Provides input to budget and helps to allocate expenditures efficiently for activities individual manages. Forecasts resource needs. Identifies opportunities to reduce costs.
  • People leadership responsibility have full HR responsibility for direct reports and/or indirect reports
  • Sets goals that have short-term (0-3) years positive impact on team members and the organization.
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:
  • BS in Science or Engineering and 5+ years experience in product development OR MS/PhD in Science or Engineering and 3+ years experience in product development
  • Strong large data set manipulation and visualization (using JMP, R, and/or Python) skills.
  • Demonstrated people leadership capability
  • Strong technical writing skills
  • Experience in experimental design (DOE)
Roche is an equal opportunity employer.
